poem:
Title: "Lament for a Dying Flame"

In ochre chambers of power, they stir,
Men of earth's buried fire, they conspire.
In deceits, wrapped like fossils, buried deep,
Lie truths choked by century's shroud.
The ash of doubt they sow, sinister and sly,
Yet at last, justice's gaze turns their way.
Oh barren earth, shaken by drunken drill,
Soon shall your liquid dark scream no longer.
